application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
decision_conditions: The applicant has not adequately demonstrated that condition 3 (Facing Materials) of planning permission 20/01105/FUL can be discharged. The proposed use of concrete tiles in the place  of the clay tile as shown on the original submission, is not supported and would not ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The information submitted is of insufficient detail to clearly demonstrate that the terms of the condition have been met.Before condition 3 (Facing Materials) of planning permission  20/01105/FUL can be discharged, Kingston Council need samples of facing materials to be submitted to the Council, to ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.
description: Details required for Conditions 3 (Materials) and 19 (Design Details) of planning permission  20/01105/FUL (Demolition of part existing dwelling (extension) to create access to rear and erection of 2 no. x  five bed dwellings including parking and associated works (revised design details))
